column5: Hey Spiel, Looky here what I found !!!  I imagine this pic was taken around the same era as yours!!!
I don't remember when these were taken but it was wayyyy back when Owen Sound had salmon... Me & Bruce

....With all these ice reports from Binbrook on the board lately I decided it would be fun to post a few summer time pictures of the terrific fishing a few friends and I used to enjoy at Binbrook from the comforts of my 16' square back sportspal with an old Sears Gamefisher electric. Enjoy!    Me and a typical Largie    My Buddy with a better than average Northern    and finally another buddy with a typical stringer of walleye. At the time it was pretty easy to get a mess of these everytime we went out.
2 words...  OLD SCHOOL...
Geeze Chrissy, I think that outfit is back in style!
Dang girly man, my sister has hair like that....
Those were the good ole days... when you had time to pull the tour bus over between gigs and fish out of your squareback.
Great pics. I bet they bring back some long forgotten memories and proof that you actually do catch fish.  Thanks for posting them.
Hippie  Holy Crap Chris - you have OVER 5000 posts.  Joey
I think i have the same shirt ,still in my closet
lol....Well you might have if you played on the 12-10 mill (Stelco) ball team back in 78-79.
I hate to say it, but that shirt and I would be the same age!  Haha!

Dude what a wicked post!!! when you told me you were working on it I couldnt wait to see it!! and you didnt disappoint! feel free to post those old pics anytime you want and I know you got THOUSANDS!!!   Dude... get a haircut   Gerritt.
....Ah Snady you is making me feel old.    and Gerritt if you haven't noticed I don't have much hair left to cut. Dang I hate Barbers!
Blame genetics.... not the barber  Gerritt.
I'm guessing mid-eighties? Thanks for sharing.
....Yes Joey I sure do....lol (note to self, "get a life!")   Clampet those pictures would be late 70"s
Thanks for that Spiel, it's always nice lookin back on the good ole days !!
They had camera's invented that long ago?
i thought the world was B&W back then?  did ted turner get his paws on those pics?

C: Dad, how come old photographs are always black and white? Didn't they have color film back then? D: Sure they did. In fact, those old photographs ARE in color. It's just the WORLD was black and white then.  C: Really? D: Yep. The world didn't turn color until sometime in the 1930s, and it was pretty grainy color for a while, too.  C: That's really weird. D: Well, truth is stranger than fiction.  C: But then why are old PAINTINGS in color?! If the world was black and white, wouldn't artists have painted it that way? D: Not necessarily. A lot of great artists were insane.  C: But... but how could they have painted in color anyway? Wouldn't their paints have been shades of gray back then? D: Of course, but they turned colors like everything else in the '30s.  C: So why didn't old black and white photos turn color too? D: Because they were color pictures of black and white, remember?

Spiel those are some great pics of some great fishing!  I used to fish the lake in the late 70's and early 80's and I remember my cousin telling me of a huge walleye he caught there.  I always thought it was just a story but now that I see your pics, I probably owe him an opology, eh?  lol  That lake has a special place in my heart because the first bass I ever caught was right there.  Like maybe 1980 or 1981.  Anyhow, I remember the fish and the fight like it was yesterday.  I think for many of us Hamiltonians, that was our first taste of fishing and the great outdoors.  Thanks for posting those photos!
Hey Chris..Yer kind of a cute feller!!!!I have some pics somewhere of me longhair days somewhere.My daughter gets a laugh out of them.. Joe
Nice try. As if it's not the same guy. Trying to make us believe that you had more than one buddy way back then??
gotta love the old times...eh well at least you have some photos i have alot to but im not sure how to get them online,and thats a nice stringer of walleyes for sure...
Classic pictures.  My mom has ones like that in a photo album somewhere.  I'll have to dig them out the next time I see her!  Thanks for the blast from the past!

Thanks for sharing those pictures Chris  That pike has a big head ...and the classic walleye on the stringer shot...  ~ Ohh what I would do to be on my favorite shoal right now in the boat nailing walleye~  Good fishing  -Andrew
